snippet.textDisplay:
Craig's really struggling here. No-one is denying that Leicester still have a chance of winning the league, they are just saying it is unlikely. Craig's trying to pretend Steve and Don are saying Leicester have no chance whatsoever.


Put it this way, Liverpool have shown they can keep near enough this pace for an entire season; not only have Leicester not shown that, but they are going at a slower pace to begin with. Based on that, it is entirely reasonable to believe that Liverpool are going to win the league.
snippet.textOriginal:
Craig's really struggling here. No-one is denying that Leicester still have a chance of winning the league, they are just saying it is unlikely. Craig's trying to pretend Steve and Don are saying Leicester have no chance whatsoever.


Put it this way, Liverpool have shown they can keep near enough this pace for an entire season; not only have Leicester _not_ shown that, but they are going at a slower pace to begin with. Based on that, it is entirely reasonable to believe that Liverpool are going to win the league.

snippet.textDisplay:
No one is denying how good this leicester team is, but in theory Leicester have to go close to unbeaten from here.
Another point too, yes this impressive Leicester team have won 9 on the bounce but look at the teams they have played:
Aston Villa - 17th - relegation candidates
Watford - 20th - worst team in the league
Everton - 14th - playing poorly
Brighton - 12th - on the slide recently
Arsenal - 9th - currently the worst season they have had
Crystal Palace - 10th - tough opponents but no top 6 candidates
Burton - bottom half of league one
Southampton - 18th - poor season
Burnley - 13th - distinctly average

Yes you have to beat the team in front of you each game but those teams are in poor form. The fixture list has been kind to Leicester. They have lost to Liverpool and United, and drew with Chelsea and Wolves.
snippet.textOriginal:
No one is denying how good this leicester team is, but in theory Leicester have to go close to unbeaten from here.
Another point too, yes this impressive Leicester team have won 9 on the bounce but look at the teams they have played:
Aston Villa - 17th - relegation candidates
Watford - 20th - worst team in the league
Everton - 14th - playing poorly
Brighton - 12th - on the slide recently
Arsenal - 9th - currently the worst season they have had
Crystal Palace - 10th - tough opponents but no top 6 candidates
Burton - bottom half of league one
Southampton - 18th - poor season
Burnley - 13th - distinctly average

Yes you have to beat the team in front of you each game but those teams are in poor form. The fixture list has been kind to Leicester. They have lost to Liverpool and United, and drew with Chelsea and Wolves.

snippet.textDisplay:
People need to stop bringing up the 10 points lead that Liverpool had over Man City by New Years. They had a game in hand + once City won against Liverpool, they made it a 4 points lead. Liverpool drawing to United, Leicester and Everton ruined their chances to win the league, while Man City went on a ridiculous unbeaten run.


Also so far, Man City have already dropped too many points. Leceister don't have the depth to replicate what City did last season against Liverpool even without Europe. Additionally, this Liverpool squad have won the Champions League and Super Cup. They know what it's like to win now. They will fight till the end. It's very clear that Klopp has been reserving a lot of his players energy right now due to the insane amount of games we have to play. Come January, hopefully with more breathing room, the team will high it into second or third gear.
snippet.textOriginal:
People need to stop bringing up the 10 points lead that Liverpool had over Man City by New Years. They had a game in hand + once City won against Liverpool, they made it a 4 points lead. Liverpool drawing to United, Leicester and Everton ruined their chances to win the league, while Man City went on a ridiculous unbeaten run. 


Also so far, Man City have already dropped too many points. Leceister don't have the depth to replicate what City did last season against Liverpool even without Europe. Additionally, this Liverpool squad have won the Champions League and Super Cup. They know what it's like to win now. They will fight till the end. It's very clear that Klopp has been reserving a lot of his players energy right now due to the insane amount of games we have to play. Come January, hopefully with more breathing room, the team will high it into second or third gear.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's not that Liverpool have to lose 8 points. It's that they have to lose 8 more points than Leicester City lose. Yes, realistically Liverpool are bound to draw or get beaten before the end of the season - and several times at that. But Leicester City are very likely to lose just as many points, if not more. They lost more in the first half, after all.

It's foolish to say Liverpool have it won when obviously they don't. But it is true to say that they look extremely likely to win it - and much more likely to than anybody else.
snippet.textOriginal:
It's not that Liverpool have to lose 8 points. It's that they have to lose 8 more points than Leicester City lose. Yes, realistically Liverpool are bound to draw or get beaten before the end of the season - and several times at that. But Leicester City are very likely to lose just as many points, if not more. They lost more in the first half, after all.

It's foolish to say Liverpool have it won when obviously they don't. But it is true to say that they look extremely likely to win it - and much more likely to than anybody else.

snippet.textDisplay:
Liverpool fan here. Leicester has a better defensive record than Liverpool. They've scored 1 goal fewer than Liverpool. Are they legit title challengers? Absolutely. People are crazy to dismiss Leicester's threat to Liverpool's title charge. But are Leicester favourites? Absolutely not. The strongest argument to make for Liverpool's case is in fact their league performance last season. They got 97 points, lost once, and have only dropped points once almost halfway into this season. All signs point to them maintaining the sort of form needed to win the title.


But history also points to Liverpool being capable of blowing a big lead in January to March. They lost a 7 point lead to Man City just last season. And Newcastle had blown a lead even bigger than that before. So it's not impossible for Leicester or even Man City to win the title.


The odds are on Liverpool's side though. There's nothing subjective about that. Nothing's definitive...yet. Why is everyone getting their tits all bent out of shape?
snippet.textOriginal:
Liverpool fan here. Leicester has a better defensive record than Liverpool. They've scored 1 goal fewer than Liverpool. Are they legit title challengers? Absolutely. People are crazy to dismiss Leicester's threat to Liverpool's title charge. But are Leicester favourites? Absolutely not. The strongest argument to make for Liverpool's case is in fact their league performance last season. They got 97 points, lost once, and have only dropped points once almost halfway into this season. All signs point to them maintaining the sort of form needed to win the title.


But history also points to Liverpool being capable of blowing a big lead in January to March. They lost a 7 point lead to Man City just last season. And Newcastle had blown a lead even bigger than that before. So it's not impossible for Leicester or even Man City to win the title.


The odds are on Liverpool's side though. There's nothing subjective about that. Nothing's definitive...yet. Why is everyone getting their tits all bent out of shape?
